greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of paths from (0,0) to (3n,0) that stay in the first quadrant (but may touch the horizontal axis), consisting of steps u=(2,1),U=(1,2), or d=(1,-1) and have k peaks of the form Ud.
comment: Number of Ud peaks in all paths from (0,0) to (3n,0) is given by A108427.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Emeric Deutsch, Problem 10658: Another Type of Lattice Path, American Math. Monthly, 107, 2000, 368-370.
example: Example T(2,1) = 5 because we have udUdd, uUddd, Uddud, Ududd and UUdddd.
maple: T:=(n,k)->binomial(n,k)*binomial(3*n-k,n-1)/n: print(1); for n from 1 to 9 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: Table[If[n == 0, 1, (1/n)*Binomial[n, k]*Binomial[3 n - k, n - 1]], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 29 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,10, for(k=0,n, print1(if(n==0, 1, (1/n)*binomial(n,k) *binomial(3*n-k,n-1)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 29 2017
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 03 2005
